sentences.cn: 新近获得行医许可的医生

sentences.en: Builders must fasten down roofs of newly-built homes more securely.
sentences.cn: 建造工人必须把新建房屋的屋顶固定得更牢靠些。

sentences.en: Even newly built houses can need repairs.
sentences.cn: 即使是新建的房子也可能需要维修。

sentences.en: He seemed to be pleased by this newly minted vehicle.
sentences.cn: 他似乎很满意这辆新出厂的车。

sentences.en: I rammed down the earth around the newly - planted tree.
sentences.cn: 我将新栽的树周围的土捣硬.

sentences.en: Officials tussled over who had responsibility for the newly fashionable unemployment agenda.
sentences.cn: 众官员为谁负责最近备受关注的失业议题一事争得不可开交。

sentences.en: Roberts was then a newly married man.
She was sitting in her newly-acquired wheelchair.
sentences.cn: 她正坐在新买的轮椅上。

sentences.en: She was young at the time, and newly married.
The Altea is a newly built first-class hotel.
sentences.cn: 阿尔特阿是家新建的高级宾馆。

sentences.en: The critics immediately homed in on the group's newly-elected members.
sentences.cn: 批评家马上将矛头对准该组织新选出的成员。

sentences.en: The newly discover-ed notes are nothing more than Lang's personal journal.
sentences.cn: 新发现的笔记只不过是朗的个人日志。

sentences.en: The newly published booklet breaks down into three parts.
sentences.cn: 这本新出版的小册子分成三部分.

sentences.en: the scent of newly scythed grass
sentences.cn: 新割下的草散发的清香

words.tran_cn: 新的，新鲜的；更新的；初见的

trans.tran_cn: 新近，最近，重新，又，再度，以新的方式，乍
trans.tran_en: Newly is used before a past participle or an adjective to indicate that a particular action is very recent, or that a particular state of affairs has very recently begun to exist
